newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australia sends triple murderer back to Britain.
newsitem.headline: Australia sends triple murderer back to Britain.

text.p: Convicted triple murderer Archie "Mad Dog" McCafferty was deported from Australia to Britain on Thursday following his release after 23 years in jail.
Glasgow-born McCafferty, who was granted parole on his fifth attempt earlier this month, last week lost a last-ditch bid to have his deportation order overturned.
"I can confirm he has departed Australia," an immigration department spokeswoman told Reuters. Local media reported McCafferty left Australia bound for Britain on a Qantas flight from Sydney.
McCafferty, 49, was sentenced to life in jail in 1974 as the leader of a gang which killed three men in Sydney in five days after his baby son suffocated while breastfeeding.
McCafferty, who came to Australia with his family as a 10-year-old but never became an Australian citizen, said he had suffered a delusion telling him to kill seven people.
Australian media nicknamed McCafferty "Mad Dog" because of his killings.
The New South Wales Parole Board earlier this month said McCafferty had been a model prisoner since 1988 and had successfully spent four months on work release.
